title: Capacitor - V and E-field as plates move apart

content.description: In State <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, an isolated parallel-plate capacitor has equal amounts of charge of opposite sign on each plate. In State <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the plates have been pulled further apart. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the potential difference across the plates and the magnitude of the electric field between the plates increases, decreases, or stays the same between states <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?
